note.p: Career: Studied pharmacy and chemistry, Rouen; went to Paris and took up natural history (1757); set up and taught a public course in natural history, Jardin des Plantes, Paris (1756-1788); Head of the Prince of Conde's Cabinet of Physics and Natural history, Chantilly (1769); added his own collections to those of the Prince, and all were confiscated at the Revolution (1789) at which time he destroyed his own diaries; Assistant member, Mineralogy Section, Institut de France (1795); Professor of Natural History, Ecole centrale (1796-1806); Assistant Headmaster, Lycee Charlemagne (1806)
Notes: Notes on certificate: 'ballotted for 4 June 1767 and rejected'; 'to Lie upon the table according to statute'
